title: Lindsay Lohan says she was racially profiled
text:
Lindsay Lohan says she was racially profiled and asked to remove her headscarf at London airport Lindsay Lohan says she was racially profiled NEW YORK DAILY NEWS Tuesday, February 21, 2017, 9:55 AM 
Lindsay Lohan claims she the victim of racial profiling at London's Heathrow Airport, and the entire ordeal left her in shock. 
The "Mean Girls" actress said Tuesday on "Good Morning Britain" that while flying out of London to New York recently she was stopped by an airport attendant and asked to take off the headscarf she was wearing. 
"I got stopped at the airport and was racially profiled for the first time in my life," she told hosts Piers Morgan and Susanna Reid. "She opened my passport and saw Lindsay Lohan and started apologizing but said, 'Please, take off your headscarf.'" Lindsay Lohan says she was racially profiled at a London airport for wearing a headscarf. (Anadolu Agency/Getty Images) 
Lohan, 30, said she wasn't sure if she was targeted because the airport attendant thought she was Muslim, but said the incident was "jarring." 
Lindsay Lohan meets with Syrian Twitter girl Bana Alabed 
"I mean, it's OK. But what scared me was that moment, how would another woman who doesn't feel comfortable taking off her headscarf feel?" she asked. "That was really interesting to me. I was kind of in shock." 
The actress also addressed rumors she was converting to Islam , telling Morgan and Reid that she's been studying the religion because she finds solace in it. 
"You can't just convert to a religion overnight," Lohan explained. "I just study it, nothing is confirmed yet. The Islamic culture, I feel it's a family to me, they've been really good people to me.‚Äù Tags:
